concise_definition: v. 牺牲, 奉献, 使放弃

definitions.explanation_en: To give up something valuable or important for the sake of something else considered more important or worthy, often involving personal loss or hardship.
definitions.explanation_cn: 为了追求更有价值或更重要的事物而主动放弃某样珍贵或重要的东西，通常伴随着个人的损失或痛苦。
definitions.example_en: She was sacrificing her weekend leisure time to finish the project on time.
definitions.example_cn: 她为了按时完成项目，牺牲了周末的休闲时间。

definitions.explanation_en: To offer something, especially an animal or object, as a religious or ceremonial offering to a deity or higher power.
definitions.explanation_cn: 将某物（尤指动物或物品）作为宗教或仪式性供品献给神灵或更高力量。
definitions.example_en: In ancient cultures, people were sacrificing livestock to appease the gods.
definitions.example_cn: 在古代文化中，人们会宰杀牲畜以安抚神灵。

definitions.explanation_en: To allow something to be damaged, lost, or compromised in order to achieve a desired outcome or benefit.
definitions.explanation_cn: 为了达成某种期望的结果或利益，而允许某物受损、丧失或被削弱。
definitions.example_en: He was sacrificing his health by working 80-hour weeks.
definitions.example_cn: 他每周工作80小时，正在牺牲自己的健康。

comparison.analysis: “Giving up”（放弃）语气较轻，通常指停止努力或不再坚持，不一定涉及重大价值或主动选择。而 “sacrificing” 强调有意识地放弃有价值的东西，带有道德或情感上的沉重感，通常是为了更高目标。
“Renouncing”（放弃/断绝）常用于正式或法律语境，指公开声明脱离某种权利、信仰或关系，强调决绝和永久性。而 “sacrificing” 更侧重于为换取其他利益而暂时或永久性地付出代价，情感色彩更浓。
“Forfeiting”（丧失/被剥夺）通常指因违反规则、过失或法律后果而失去某物，带有被动或惩罚性含义。而 “sacrificing” 是主动、自愿的行为，即使有代价，也出于意愿或信念。
